definition: tisane/decoction (Chinese medicine)
rushing current
soup/hot or boiling water/decoction of medicinal herbs/water in which sth has been boiled
surname Tang
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
(coll.) to pay compensation for medical expenses

sentences.english: B：Would you prefer tablets or liquid form?
Make an infusion by boiling and simmering the rhubarb and camomile together.
sentences.chinese: 將大黃和甘菊一起煮沸再用文火燉，熬成湯藥。

sentences.english: Make an infusion by boiling and simmering the rhubarb and camomile together…
sentences.chinese: 將大黃和甘菊一起煮沸再用文火燉，熬成湯藥。

sentences.english: Drum Tower in Beijing Chinese medicine hospital near the inside, soup medicine is required.
sentences.chinese: 就在北京鼓樓附近的中醫院裏面，喝湯藥也行。

sentences.english: Drain 40~50 ml of the decoction. This is the first dose.
sentences.chinese: 從罐中倒出40～50毫升煎好的湯藥，這是頭煎。

sentences.english: Eat a lot of him for the medical expenses, most of which were bleeding.
sentences.chinese: 吃了不少的湯藥，大部分都是止血的。

sentences.english: Both treatment and control groups were treated with basic treatment including calcium supplementation and preparation stage with herb decoction.
sentences.chinese: 兩組均採用基礎治療，包括補充鈣劑和湯藥準備階段。

definition: (TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)
prescription/recipe (Chinese medicine)
tonic
herbal plaster applied to a wound
patent medicine/medicine already made up
to take medicine
treatment involving the use of tonics to restore the patient's health/reinforcing method (in acupuncture)
to investigate
medicinal dietary supplement that helps build up one's health
legendary magic potion of immortals/panacea/fig. wonder solution to a problem
correct diagnosis/to prescribe the right cure for an illness/to suit the medicine to the illness
antipyretic (drug to reduce fever, such as sulfanilamide)
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
to dispense (drugs)/to prescribe
tonic
prescription
